title: Check the air quality in any location you want!

aqi.title: Air Quality Index
aqi.description: The Air Quality Index (AQI) measures air pollution levels, assessing its impact on health based on concentrations of harmful substances like PM2.5, PM10, nitrogen dioxide (NO2), and ozone (O3). AQI values are presented on a scale that indicates risk levels, allowing users to make informed decisions about outdoor activities.

pm10.title: PM10 Particulates
pm10.description: PM10 particles, less than 10 micrometers in diameter, can settle in the upper respiratory tract and bronchi, causing coughing, shortness of breath, and difficulty breathing, especially during physical exertion. They increase the risk of respiratory infections and may aggravate allergy symptoms, such as asthma and conjunctivitis.

pm2_5.title: PM 2.5 Particulates
pm2_5.description: Fine PM2.5 particles, smaller than 2.5 micrometers, can penetrate the lower respiratory tract and bloodstream, increasing the risk of heart diseases like hypertension and heart attack over prolonged exposure, as well as lung cancer. These particles, like PM10, can cause coughing, shortness of breath, and difficulty breathing, especially during physical activity.

no2.title: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2)
no2.description: NO2, a gas mainly generated during fuel combustion, can irritate respiratory pathways. Long-term exposure may cause chronic respiratory diseases and increase lung infection risk. NO2 may also exacerbate asthma symptoms and negatively impact child development.

o3.title: Ozone (O3)
o3.description: Ozone, while protective against UV radiation in the upper atmosphere, can be harmful at ground level. Breathing in ozone can irritate respiratory passages, cause coughing, and make breathing difficult, especially for those with respiratory illnesses. High ozone levels can also lower lung capacity and affect heart health.

so2.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2)
so2.description: SO2, a gas released during the burning of fossil fuels and industrial processes, can irritate respiratory passages, cause coughing, and exacerbate asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) symptoms. Prolonged SO2 exposure may lead to lung diseases and increase the risk of heart disease.

co.title: Carbon Monoxide (CO)
co.description: Carbon monoxide, a colorless and odorless gas produced by incomplete fuel combustion, is dangerous because it binds with hemoglobin in the blood, causing oxygen deprivation. Symptoms of CO poisoning include headache, dizziness, weakness, and, in extreme cases, can be fatal. People with heart and respiratory diseases are especially vulnerable to COâ€™s adverse effects.

data.clearDataConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete all data?
data.clearDataWarning: This action will delete all user data and reset app settings. It cannot be undone.

info.technologyDetails: The app uses React Native for its user interface. With the i18next library, the app supports multiple languages, enhancing its accessibility on the global market. AsyncStorage ensures secure and efficient local data storage, allowing users to access personalized settings.
info.descriptionText: Created for the Hack Heroes 2024 contest, this advanced app allows users to monitor air quality worldwide. Users can check pollution levels and environmental conditions in any location, no matter where they are. The app supports multiple languages, making it accessible to users from diverse countries and cultures.
info.secondDescriptionText: Designed with safety and timeliness in mind, the app regularly retrieves data from reliable sources to provide the most accurate information. It also ensures a high standard of user privacy protection. This is a perfect tool for health- and environment-conscious individuals who want to stay aware of the air quality around them and in other regions worldwide.
